alert.note: Alert for Box Elder (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 16 at 10:33PM MDT until further notice by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Utah... Bear River At Corinne affecting Box Elder County. .Snowmelt and increased reservoir releases will cause the river flows to become high. Expect minor flooding downstream from the dam. For the Blacksmith Fork River near Hyrum...and the Bear River near Corinne...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Bear River At Corinne. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 15.5 feet (7897 CFS), Minor flooding will occur to agricultural land and associated roads adjacent to the Bear River near the Great Salt Lake. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 PM MDT Tuesday the stage was 14.0 feet (6422 CFS). - Forecast...The Bear River continues to remain above action stage and will slowly rise to near flood stage by this weekend. - Action stage is 13.4 feet (5945 CFS). - Flood stage is 15.5 feet (7897 CFS). &&
info.instruction: If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by 1200 MDT Wednesday morning.
